query.result:
1 Neither the speaking the going, nor the going of him more slow 2 made, but reasoning we went strong, 3 just as a ship driven by good wind;
4 and the shadows, which seemed dead things, 5 through the hollows of the eyes admiration 6 drew from me, of my life aware.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
7 E io, continüando al mio sermone, 8 dissi: «Ella sen va sù forse più tarda 9 che non farebbe, per altrui cagione.
query.result: 7 And I, continuing to my discourse, 8 said: “She goes up perhaps more slowly 9 than she would do, for another’s reason.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
10 Ma dimmi, se tu sai, dov’ è Piccarda; 11 dimmi s’io veggio da notar persona 12 tra questa gente che sì mi riguarda».

Please translate each line literally into English.
13 «La mia sorella, che tra bella e buona 14 non so qual fosse più, trïunfa lieta 15 ne l’alto Olimpo già di sua corona».
query.result: 13 “My sister, who between beautiful and good 14 I do not know which was more, triumphs joyful 15 in the high Olympus already of her crown.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
16 Sì disse prima; e poi: «Qui non si vieta 17 di nominar ciascun, da ch’è sì munta 18 nostra sembianza via per la dïeta.
query.result: 16 Thus it was said before; and then: “Here it is not forbidden 17 to name each one, since so much is changed 18 our appearance through the diet.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
19 Questi», e mostrò col dito, «è Bonagiunta, 20 Bonagiunta da Lucca; e quella faccia 21 di là da lui più che l’altre trapunta
22 ebbe la Santa Chiesa in le sue braccia: 23 dal Torso fu, e purga per digiuno 24 l’anguille di Bolsena e la vernaccia».
query.result:
19 This,” and showed with the finger, “is Bonagiunta, 20 Bonagiunta from Lucca; and that face 21 over there from him more than the others pierces
22 had the Holy Church in its arms: 23 he was from Torso, and purges through fasting 24 the eels of Bolsena and the vernaccia.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
25 Molti altri mi nomò ad uno ad uno; 26 e del nomar parean tutti contenti, 27 sì ch’io però non vidi un atto bruno.

Please translate each line literally into English.
28 Vidi per fame a vòto usar li denti 29 Ubaldin da la Pila e Bonifazio 30 che pasturò col rocco molte genti.
query.result: 28 I saw, through hunger, use their teeth in vain 29 Ubaldin from the Pila and Boniface 30 who pastured with the staff many people.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
31 Vidi messer Marchese, ch’ebbe spazio 32 già di bere a Forlì con men secchezza, 33 e sì fu tal, che non si sentì sazio.
query.result: 31 I saw Messer Marchese, who had space 32 already to drink in Forlì with less dryness, 33 and so he was such, that he did not feel satisfied.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
34 Ma come fa chi guarda e poi s’apprezza 35 più d’un che d’altro, fei a quel da Lucca, 36 che più parea di me aver contezza.
query.result: 34 But as does he who looks and then appreciates 35 more one than another, I did to that from Lucca, 36 who seemed to me to have more knowledge.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
37 El mormorava; e non so che «Gentucca» 38 sentiv’ io là, ov’ el sentia la piaga 39 de la giustizia che sì li pilucca.
query.result: 37 He was murmuring; and I do not know what “Little people” 38 I heard there, where he felt the wound 39 of the justice that so plucks them.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
40 «O anima», diss’ io, «che par sì vaga 41 di parlar meco, fa sì ch’io t’intenda, 42 e te e me col tuo parlare appaga».
query.result: 40 “O soul,” I said, “that seems so eager 41 to speak with me, do so that I understand you, 42 and with your speaking satisfy you and me.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
43 «Femmina è nata, e non porta ancor benda», 44 cominciò el, «che ti farà piacere 45 la mia città, come ch’om la riprenda.
query.result: 43 “A woman is born, and does not yet wear a veil,” 44 he began, “that will give you pleasure 45 my city, as one takes it back.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
46 Tu te n’andrai con questo antivedere: 47 se nel mio mormorar prendesti errore, 48 dichiareranti ancor le cose vere.
query.result: 46 You will go away with this foresight: 47 if in my murmuring you took an error, 48 you will still declare the true things.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
49 Ma dì s’i’ veggio qui colui che fore 50 trasse le nove rime, cominciando 51 ‘Donne ch’avete intelletto d’amore’».
query.result: 49 But say if I see here the one who before 50 led forth the nine rhymes, beginning 51 ‘Ladies who have understanding of love.’"

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
52 E io a lui: «I’ mi son un che, quando 53 Amor mi spira, noto, e a quel modo 54 ch’e’ ditta dentro vo significando».
query.result: 52 And I to him: “I am one who, when 53 Love inspires me, notes, and in that manner 54 which he dictates within, I am signifying.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
55 «O frate, issa vegg’ io», diss’ elli, «il nodo 56 che ’l Notaro e Guittone e me ritenne 57 di qua dal dolce stil novo ch’i’ odo!
58 Io veggio ben come le vostre penne 59 di retro al dittator sen vanno strette, 60 che de le nostre certo non avvenne;
61 e qual più a gradire oltre si mette, 62 non vede più da l’uno a l’altro stilo»; 63 e, quasi contentato, si tacette.

Please translate each line literally into English.
64 Come li augei che vernan lungo ’l Nilo, 65 alcuna volta in aere fanno schiera, 66 poi volan più a fretta e vanno in filo,
67 così tutta la gente che lì era, 68 volgendo ’l viso, raffrettò suo passo, 69 e per magrezza e per voler leggera.
query.result:
64 As the birds that return along the Nile, 65 sometimes make formation in the air, 66 then they fly more quickly and go in a line,
67 thus all the people who were there, 68 turning their faces, hastened their step, 69 and because of thinness and because of light desire.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
70 E come l’uom che di trottare è lasso, 71 lascia andar li compagni, e sì passeggia 72 fin che si sfoghi l’affollar del casso,
73 sì lasciò trapassar la santa greggia 74 Forese, e dietro meco sen veniva, 75 dicendo: «Quando fia ch’io ti riveggia?».
query.result:
70 And as the man who is weary of trotting, 71 lets go the companions, and thus walks 72 until he relieves the crowding of the road,
73 thus he let pass the holy flock, 74 Perhaps, and behind me he came, 75 saying: “When will it be that I see you again?”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
82 «Or va», diss’ el; «che quei che più n’ha colpa, 83 vegg’ ïo a coda d’una bestia tratto 84 inver’ la valle ove mai non si scolpa.
query.result: 82 “Now go,” said he, “for he who has more guilt, 83 I see drawn to the tail of a beast 84 towards the valley where never is excused.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
85 La bestia ad ogne passo va più ratto, 86 crescendo sempre, fin ch’ella il percuote, 87 e lascia il corpo vilmente disfatto.
query.result: 85 The beast with every step goes more quickly, 86 growing always, until it strikes him, 87 and leaves the body vilely undone.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
88 Non hanno molto a volger quelle ruote», 89 e drizzò li occhi al ciel, «che ti fia chiaro 90 ciò che ’l mio dir più dichiarar non puote.
query.result: 88 They do not have much to turn those wheels,” 89 and he raised his eyes to the sky, “so that it may be clear to you 90 what my saying cannot declare more fully.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
91 Tu ti rimani omai; ché ’l tempo è caro 92 in questo regno, sì ch’io perdo troppo 93 venendo teco sì a paro a paro».
query.result: 91 You remain now, because time is precious 92 in this realm, so that I lose too much 93 coming with you so step by step.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
94 Qual esce alcuna volta di gualoppo 95 lo cavalier di schiera che cavalchi, 96 e va per farsi onor del primo intoppo,
97 tal si partì da noi con maggior valchi; 98 e io rimasi in via con esso i due 99 che fuor del mondo sì gran marescalchi.
query.result:
94 As sometimes comes at a gallop 95 the knight of the company who rides, 96 and goes to make honor of the first difficulty,
97 thus he departed from us with greater strides; 98 and I remained on the way with him and the two 99 who were outside the world such great marshals.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
100 E quando innanzi a noi intrato fue, 101 che li occhi miei si fero a lui seguaci, 102 come la mente a le parole sue,
103 parvermi i rami gravidi e vivaci 104 d’un altro pomo, e non molto lontani 105 per esser pur allora vòlto in laci.
query.result:
100 And when he had entered before us, 101 that my eyes became fixed on him following, 102 as the mind to his words,
103 to me the branches seemed heavy and lively 104 with another fruit, and not far away 105 to be then turned into nets.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
106 Vidi gente sott’ esso alzar le mani 107 e gridar non so che verso le fronde, 108 quasi bramosi fantolini e vani
109 che pregano, e ’l pregato non risponde, 110 ma, per fare esser ben la voglia acuta, 111 tien alto lor disio e nol nasconde.
query.result:
106 I saw people beneath it raise their hands 107 and cry I know not what towards the branches, 108 almost longing little ghosts and vain ones
109 who pray, and the prayed-to does not respond, 110 but, to make the desire be truly sharp, 111 keeps their desire high and does not hide it.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
112 Poi si partì sì come ricreduta; 113 e noi venimmo al grande arbore adesso, 114 che tanti prieghi e lagrime rifiuta.

Please translate each line literally into English.
115 «Trapassate oltre sanza farvi presso: 116 legno è più sù che fu morso da Eva, 117 e questa pianta si levò da esso».
query.result: 115 Pass beyond without drawing near: 116 it is wood more above that was bitten by Eve, 117 and this plant rose from it.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
118 Sì tra le frasche non so chi diceva; 119 per che Virgilio e Stazio e io, ristretti, 120 oltre andavam dal lato che si leva.

query.result:
121 “Remember,” he said, “the cursed ones 122 formed in the clouds, who, sated, 123 Theseus fought with double breasts;
124 and of the Hebrews who showed themselves weak at the ford, 125 for which Gideon did not want them as companions, 126 when he descended the hills against Midian.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
127 Sì accostati a l’un d’i due vivagni 128 passammo, udendo colpe de la gola 129 seguite già da miseri guadagni.
query.result: 127 Thus approaching one of the two gluttons 128 we passed, hearing crimes of the throat 129 followed already by miserable gains.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
130 Poi, rallargati per la strada sola, 131 ben mille passi e più ci portar oltre, 132 contemplando ciascun sanza parola.
query.result: 130 Then, widened by the solitary road, 131 well a thousand steps and more carried us beyond, 132 contemplating each one without a word.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
133 «Che andate pensando sì voi sol tre?». 134 sùbita voce disse; ond’ io mi scossi 135 come fan bestie spaventate e poltre.
query.result: 133 “What are you going thinking, you three alone?” 134 a sudden voice said; from which I shook myself 135 as do frightened beasts and slow ones.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
136 Drizzai la testa per veder chi fossi; 137 e già mai non si videro in fornace 138 vetri o metalli sì lucenti e rossi,
139 com’ io vidi un che dicea: «S’a voi piace 140 montare in sù, qui si convien dar volta; 141 quinci si va chi vuole andar per pace».

Please translate each line literally into English.
142 L’aspetto suo m’avea la vista tolta; 143 per ch’io mi volsi dietro a’ miei dottori, 144 com’ om che va secondo ch’elli ascolta.

query.result:
145 As, announcer of the dawns, 146 the breeze of May moves and fragrance, 147 all impregnated by the grass and the flowers;
148 thus I felt a wind pass over me 149 the forehead, and well felt move the plume, 150 that made feel of ambrosia the sweetness.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
151 E senti’ dir: «Beati cui alluma 152 tanto di grazia, che l’amor del gusto 153 nel petto lor troppo disir non fuma,
154 esurïendo sempre quanto è giusto!».
query.result:
151 And I heard say: “Blessed are those whom illuminates 152 so much of grace, that the love of taste 153 in their breast too much desire does not smoke,
154 always yearning as much as is right!”
